div.h6: Board of Directors Meeting 4/28 @ 6 PM :Virtual [Link Provided]

tr.td:
April 21st, 2020
COVID-19 Closure & Distance Learning Update

Dear ADS Families,Last Friday, Governor Greg Abbott announced an executive order to close all schools in the state of Texas for the remainder of the 2019-20 academic year. Austin Discovery School will comply with this executive order. While the ADS campus will remain closed, distance learning will continue for the rest of the school year. We know this is difficult news to process. Our teachers and faculty dearly miss being with our students on campus and while we wish we could be reunited again this school year, we are happy to do our part to keep our community and neighbors safe. We look forward to the day when we can return to our beautiful campus as one ADS family together, but for now, we must be together in spirit while remaining apart. This closure is not how our eighth graders envisioned the end of their last year at ADS, and we are especially sad for them. We are currently exploring options for a virtual graduation so that they do not miss out on this special experience. Please be sure to check out the Hoot every week for additional school communications.After much discussion and careful thought, we have adjusted our grading guidelines for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Paired with our distance learning model, these guidelines will allow students to demonstrate mastery of curriculum and standards from home and for teachers to provide meaningful feedback to students and families. Our hope is for as many students as possible to enter the 20-21 school year prepared and ready to learn.
———————————————————————————————
The ADS COVID-19 grading guidelines will be begin this week and are as follows:
Teachers will monitor student performance and progress toward proficiency of skills and content via online learning platforms and an end of the year assessment in each subject. Based on completion of assigned work, students will receive a “Complete” for the trimester. For Middle School students, yearlong averages will be calculated by averaging the first and second trimester grades for each class.Any students who do not adequately participate in distance learning assignments or end of year assessments will receive an “Incomplete”. Participation:Adequate participation is defined as students who participate in 60% or more of the required Google classroom and IXL assignments, as well as complete their End of Year assessments. Teachers will document weekly completion of work. If a student does not participate in 60% or more of the required IXL work and/or does not complete their End of Year assessments, they will receive an Incomplete for the trimester. All students who have specific learning plans in place through Section 504, Special Education, or MTSS will instead follow the requirements outlined in those plans.A record of incomplete in the third trimester will not affect a student’s ability to continue to the next grade, but will identify students who will likely need extra support next year.
—————————————————————————————
We have been blown away by the ingenuity of our teachers and faculty who have found creative new ways to connect with students and facilitate learning from afar. We are grateful to all of you for your patience and understanding as we have adjusted to this new normal.As always, ADS is here to support your child’s learning and wellbeing however we can. Please do not hesitate to reach out with any questions.
Warmly,
Reed Ramirez
Interim Head of School
Austin Discovery School
